sub_title: Senior Software Designer / Dental Care Units Division at Planmeca Oy
summary:
My passion is to design and implement robust, reusable, and flexible software. I like solving problems and I am skilled at outlining the logic structure for a given customer challenge or problem and translating it into code architecture and I implement it fast.

I believe that the success of software development comes down to a proficient and satisfied team. Different kinds of abilities and people complement each other by improving the innovation process and the whole software development. At the same time, the team should not lose insight to whom the product is made for and make sure that it is delivered well finished, and in time.
The same rules apply in a business or in non-professional relationships, where ever there are people, respect, fairness, and good manners take a long way.

Summary of experience:

Planmeca
I have been privileged to be developing the world’s leading imaging software Romexis from the very beginning. I have played a major role in designing and implementing the 3D part of Romexis from user interface to database and everything in between.  The cherry on the top has been working with cutting-edge technology and 3D visualization.

Since February 2020, I have worked as a Salesforce developer for Planmeca One Insights, which displays statistics and status information generated from data obtained from the use of X-ray and dental devices.

Finnish Genome Center
Gave me an insight to medical research and what is it to work in the university world.

Micro Analog Systems
I went in as an IT support and came out as a software designer. Thank to my excellent boss who understood my blossoming love to software development.

Mansikkamäki Ltd
A family business that makes coffins and urns for undertakers. Mentioned here because it gave me good work ethics and first insight how business works (regardless of somewhat grim disposition).

profile_positions.description: Salesforce development for Planmeca One Insights, which displays statistics and status information generated from data obtained from the use of X-ray and dental devices. I have primarily worked on the development of Salesforce LWC components that make Apex calls to Salesforce and GraphQL calls to Azure. In addition to LWC and Apex programming, I have become familiar with Jest testing, SF Flows, SF Platform events, embedding Echart in LWC components, and Aura components (mainly layout). Recently, the work has also expanded to include Salesforce admin tasks. Obtained Salesforce certificate (Certified JavaScript Developer I) in July 2022.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Designer / Salesforce development

profile_positions.description:
Since May 2017 design and development of the front-end of Planmeca Insights that tracks device usage, trends, and patterns over time.
Planmeca Insights front-end is created using JavaScript, TypeScript, ES6, React, Redux, and Redux-Saga.

Design and development of Clinic Management of Romexis. Clinic Management provides real-time monitoring of connected devices. Device events are recorded and device usage is summarized.
Romexis is a Java/JavaFX software that supports MS SQL, Firebird, and Oracle databases.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Designer / Dental Care Units Division

profile_positions.description:
As design manager of Romexis 3D software, I was responsible for the architectural design of submodules to be integrated into the 3D repertoire and possible architecture changes required of the whole. I also continued designing and implementing new features from user interface to database solutions and everything in between.

During this period I have participated in creating the following features:

The 4D Jaw Motion system is a cone-beam integrated system that captures the patient’s jaw movements in real-time and then displays them in the Jaw Motion module. The jaw motion images can be used for immediate diagnostics or recorded for later analysis. The patient is first imaged with a tracking device. The patient's upper and lower jaws are segmented from CBCT images resulting from the capturing. The Markers of the tracking device are also defined from CBCT data for correspondence of jaw segments and patient movement.
I was responsible for designing and implementing of jaw segmentation user interface. I also designed and implemented the integration of the Jaw Motion module and jaw segments to other sub-modules of the 3D module. I also designed and implemented the database solution for this feature.

I was also responsible for the entire design and implementation of the following features:

Implant-centric view where plane projections are centered to selected implant. Users can rotate the view around the implant and analyze it with respect to surrounded bone structure.

Virtual tooth removal - a feature that can be used to remove selected teeth from 3D X-ray data.
profile_positions.title: Design Manager, 3D software / Digital Imaging and Applications Division

profile_positions.description:
Design and further development of the Romexis 3D software.

I was responsible for the entire design and implementation of the following features:

Crown and abutment libraries. The crown library is a universal scalable set of realistic STL tooth models. The abutment library consists of realistic STL models of abutments received from implant manufacturers. An abutment is a part that is placed between the implant and the crown. Crowns and abutments are used in implant design to assess the ideal position of the implant.

MPR navigation tool - an additional way to browse 3D data in real-time. Orthogonal reference planes can be browsed while the target plane remains fixed (cf. Rubik's cube).

An object browser that collects all added elements: markings, nerves, implants, intraoral scans, and segmented teeth. The object browser also contains management tools for each element group.

Adjustable safety zone and collision detection between implants and nerves. Alignment of implants. Extension bar for better determination of the orientation of the implant in relation to the crown.

I was responsible for the architectural design and largely the implementation of the following features:

3D Reslicer tool for extracting user-defined slice stacks and importing them to a 2D Imaging module or PACS.

Overlap module - a sub-module of the 3D module, that compares two simultaneously superimposed and side-by-side CBCT volumes. Volumes can be mounted using the mount tool or manually.

I also contributed to the creation of the following features:

Planmeca Romexis Cloud is a patient data and image transfer service for Romexis users. I participated in the design and implementation of the customer interface for receiving incoming information.

A 3D tooth segmentation tool that separates a tooth from data into movable objects that can be used in the 3D orthodontic design. I was responsible for the design and implementation of the GUI.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Designer / Digital Imaging and Applications Division

profile_positions.description:
I have been responsible for development of 3D software of Romexis. Romexis is a java implemented software which has been created mainly for acquiring, viewing and processing of 2D and 3D images. 3D module is a set of interfaces for 3D X-ray image analysis, dental implant planning and diagnosis of the TMJ area for the treatment of the patient.
Software generates panoramic-, planar- and cross sectional projections of 3D CBCT data which can be used to browse through the anatomy of patient and search for targets of interest. User can make comprehensive dental implant plan by sketching nerve canals, placing realistic implant models and examine the fitting in respect to bone structure, bone density and other teeth. User can also make various annotations and measurements. 3D rendering view allows users to comprehend overall positioning of implants, nerves and 2D projection planes in respect to anatomy of patient.

I have developed the 3D module from the very beginning and I am responsible for a large part of implementation, architecture, user interface and database solutions of it. As a result I have gained thorough knowledge of software development, software designing, database planning, digital image processing, java programming language, java GUI programming, 3D modeling, java 3D, 2D graphics, 3D mathematics, various database languages, XML- and STL -file formats.

Apart from Romexis as a first job in Planmeca I created a small software that converts Solid SQL scripts to MS SQL-, Oracle SQL- and later Firebird SQL -scripts.

I also developed data migration software that converts patient data and associated 2D images of patients from former Planmeca imaging software Dimaxis and other sources to database of Romexis.

In addition I made utility software to be able to scale and turn STL files received from implant manufacturers. Software also generates SQL -scripts for database insertion from information associated with each implant.
profile_positions.title: Software Designer / Digital Imaging and Applications Division

profile_positions.description: My job description was to design and implement programs used for the analysis and processing of genotype results. Programs were mainly graphical Java -applications that communicate with Oracle -database through JDBC -interface providing aid for geneticists in data analysis. As my last task at Finnish Genome Center, I participated in the creation of a Laboratory information management system. I also created web-based database reports using xReporter.
profile_positions.title: Software Designer

I created Java- and Perl -applications for the use of the R&D department in HP-UX and Windows environments. The main job was a Java implementation for the statistical interpretation of binary data from microcircuit testing.
